title: As I understand it, postmodernism is the rejection of values and objective truth. What are some examples of postmodernism in today's society? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your sentence: It begins with the words “As I understand it…” The implication is someone else can or will understand it in another way, and so is the next person, and so on. Without a universal definition of post-modernism, everybody will claim something about it without limitation on whims, manipulation, or desire for gratification. Where there is no common ground to do something together, brute force is the arbiter of the human affairs. Some guy will invoke some “authority”, who happens to be one by popularity or official badge, but without proof of what he says. You will realize all you need is authority to be right. You will learn might makes it right. That is how destroying property in the name of “protest” can be called “peaceful.” As you understand it, “peace” means something. As the next person understands it, “peace” means something else. Eventually it comes down to the question who can destroy property and get away with it. That person is right. In a post-modern world, might makes it right. And that is the point of post-modernism. It is a confession of inability to produce, to look after oneself. Putsch or power grab are to compensate for their problem. A universal meaning of a word is what is common through all things that word is about. A universal meaning requires mental effort. It is not hidden in your thoughts or in the thing you talk about. You make it, but in a way that is true and provable by understanding the nature of the thing. Too much work? Well, apparently it is to the post-moderns.

A good example is Rachel Dolezal, who has been disavowed by the black community for pretending to have black ancestry to rise amongst to the top of the NAACP.  This is an example of rejection of values: being truthful and forthcoming. She would have been welcomed to help advance the NAACP cause as herself, so why conceal her real roots? After being forced to step down from her job, she still maintains that she didn’t do anything wrong and justifies it by “I identify as black”. In a similar note, there was a 2007 movie that made quite a sension. Based on a true story, Surviving With The Wolves followed a Jewish girl who survived with a pack of wolves during WWII and crossed 3,000 Km (1,860 miles) to be reunited with her family. The movie was based on the 1997 autobiography of Misha Defonseca.  A lot of people thought the story was too good to be true, so after some digging it was uncovered that the author was actually catholic and her father had helped to round up some Jews during the occupation and had been executed as a traitor. Somehow she made up this story to cope with the shame and the loss and started to mix up reality with fantasy. This should explain why the NAACP might be a little bit peeved: the world doesn’t have to bend around one person’s distorted perception of reality.

Examples of postmodernism in today’s philosophy are books by the following writers: Nietzsche, Heidegger, Sartre, Foucault, Derrida, Zizek, (any union of Marx with Nietzsche).These may be the most popular Continental philosophers of all time. Their work leads up to the World Wars, and is largely a sigh of pathos after the World Wars.
Some of the most blatant examples come from the extreme left of identity politics, e.g., race, racism, whiteness, justice, peaceful protest, aggression, guilt, etc. being defined to suit agendas.
